alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 10:06PM CST until March 13 at 9:48AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah For the Tennessee River...including PICKWICK DAM HEADWATER, Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING MARCH 13... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning March 13. * IMPACTS...At 371.0 feet, Federal Road is flooded at Lick Creek north of Hamburg. Parts of Lacefield Drive are covered by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 370.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CST Monday was 370.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 371.4 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall Thursday morning. It will rise to 371.4 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued tomorrow by 1200 PM CST.
